p: A possible strategy to limit viral infections is the restriction of the trafficking of furin to trans-Golgi network or to early Golgi compartments, where the pro-protein convertase remains inactive [13]. In this regard, streptamine derivatives may be particularly promising for targeted therapy, since the positioning of the guanidyl substituents leads to a localisation of the inhibitor into distinct subcellular compartments, such as endosomes or the Golgi complex [102].
